info.author: WebLion Group, Penn State University
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
AnonymousCommenting Package Readme

    Overview
        
        Implements anonymous commenting within a Plone site
        
    Credits
        
        Author: WebLion Group, Penn State University
        "support@weblion.psu.edu":mailto:support@weblion.psu.edu
        
        Release Manager: "Eric
        Steele":mailto:EricSteele+anonymouscommenting@psu.edu, esteele on
        irc.freenode.net

        Based on code from http://tomster.org/geek/plonezope/anonComments
        
    Requirements
        
        Requires Plone 3.x
        
    Using AnonymousCommenting
        
        Install the AnonymousCommenting package through Plone's Add/Remove
        Products page. AnonymousCommenting will change Plone's security
        settings to allow anonymous users to add comments to site content. It
        will also change the comment form to allow users to enter their own
        names, defaulting to the logged in user's name.
        
    Support
        
        Contact WebLion at
        "support@weblion.psu.edu":mailto:support@weblion.psu.edu, or visit our
        IRC channel: #weblion on freenode.net.
        
        Bug reports may be submitted at
        http://weblion.psu.edu/trac/weblion/newticket

    
    1.0
    * Initial product release
info.name: Products.AnonymousCommenting
info.summary: Implements anonymous commenting within a Plone site
info.html_description:
AnonymousCommenting Package Readme

Overview

Implements anonymous commenting within a Plone site

Credits

Author: WebLion Group, Penn State University “support@weblion.psu.edu”:mailto:support@weblion.psu.edu

Release Manager: “Eric Steele”:mailto:EricSteele+anonymouscommenting@psu.edu, esteele on irc.freenode.net

Based on code from http://tomster.org/geek/plonezope/anonComments

Requirements

Requires Plone 3.x

Using AnonymousCommenting

Install the AnonymousCommenting package through Plone’s Add/Remove Products page. AnonymousCommenting will change Plone’s security settings to allow anonymous users to add comments to site content. It will also change the comment form to allow users to enter their own names, defaulting to the logged in user’s name.

Support

Contact WebLion at “support@weblion.psu.edu”:mailto:support@weblion.psu.edu, or visit our IRC channel: #weblion on freenode.net.

Bug reports may be submitted at http://weblion.psu.edu/trac/weblion/newticket

1.0 * Initial product release
